metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8808 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The DecodeImage function in coders/gif.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.18 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory access) via a crafted GIF file. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8808` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1build1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1build1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1build1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1build1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1build1').
